content: Thunderbird cannot block messages, but can filter them from your view. To do that, create a filter that selects on content that is in the messages. From your post, it appears you could set the FROM to CONTAINS and enter text that is always present. To fully remove this sender, I suggest investigating to see if your email account online has a filter or spam control tool that would completely eliminate the messages.
creator: davidsk

content: Please be more specific on your problem.
creator: davidsk

content:
Just my thoughts: - I would do IMAP (although POP could work and both have similar exposure to any interruption) - check that account settings>synchronization&storage is set for offline use - set File>offline>download to ensure all headers and messages are retrieved - once you have all messages downloaded, I would create filters to separate messages into smaller groups, in Local Folders. 

   My reasoning is that Thunderbird could choke, trying to manage 22g of mail in one folder (just my opinion)

- once done, check that all messages are accounted for and then delete the IMAP account. - finally, exit thunderbird and do two backups of the profile folder with WIndows File Explorer

AND, I suggest waiting for other suggestions, as there may be other possibilities in this.
creator: davidsk

Use these settings:

incoming: outlook.office365.com, 993 (IMAP) or 995 (POP), SSL/TLS, OAuth2 authentication, User Name = email address

outgoing: smtp.office365.com, 587, STARTTLS, OAuth2 authentication, User Name = email address

content: You need to tell us, in detail, of the steps taken in moving to new Mac.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hello David -

Thanks for responding so quickly - I followed these steps multiple times, including after turning off and on both computers - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

In the end I completely erased the new Mac back to factory settings, and redid the whole migration, not just the Thunderbird files, and everything worked perfectly with the Thunderbird.

So problem solved, but still should have worked according to the instructions, so may not be helpful for anyone else with this problem.

Thanks again, and have a great evening!

Best,

Kathryn

content:
mozilla664 said
Do you see both folders on your desktop computer? No, I can only see "Deleted Items" Do you see both folder on your phone? No, I can only see "Deleted Items" Do you see both folders on the website? No, I can only see "Trash"
creator: alalhakim

content:
I am guessing at two folders and a mapping issue: the web app puts deleted messages into "Trash", and the other apps put deleted messages into "Deleted Items", but your settings on your desktop computer and your phone are set to show you only "Deleted Items".

On your desktop, when you right click on the name of the account in the folders pane, and select "Subscribe", do you see both "Deleted Items" and "Trash" or only "Deleted Items"?

If you see "Trash", subscribe to it.

Then go to account settings - server settings, look for "When I delete a message", and see if "Trash" appears. If it does, have deleted items go to "Trash".

Then try to do the same on your phone.

My reasoning: the web app knows best. It wants deleted messages in "Trash". So you want to have deleted messages go into "Trash" on your desktop computer and your phone too, and stop using "Deleted Items".
creator: mozilla664

content:
In "Subscribe" dialog I can only see "Deleted Items" not "Trash". When I right click on the "Deleted Items" folder and select Properties. The URI is: imap://alika%40spray.se@imap.pangia.biz/Deleted%20Items

The online website shows me "Trash". A similar difference in naming is concerning spam mails. In Thunderbird it is named "Junk Mail" and on website "Spam". Can I manually add/subscribe a folder by name not found in "Subscribe" dialog? Or maybe is the online website hiding the Imap folder real name?
creator: alalhakim

content: Update the following confirms my suspicion: When I inspect network transactions on web browser while using the mail website, I go into "Trash" In one of the HTTP response messages I find: a JSON element: "mw:folder "/deleted items" "
creator: alalhakim

content:
I would trust the web app's folder mappings because it is more closely connected to the server. I believe that our task is to get your apps to use the folders that the web app uses.

The only way I know of to make a folder visible in Thunderbird is the subscribe function.

In account settings - server settings, by "When I delete a message", does "Trash" appear in the list?

If you do not see "Trash" in the subscribe list of folders and you do not see it under "When I delete a message", then my theory is probably wrong, and, I'm sorry, I don't know what else to try.
creator: mozilla664

content: Hello, the AllMail folder is a duplicate of all message folders and that is why Mozilla does not recommend subscribing to it, as it duplicates your disk storage and doubles time to send and receive. My suggestion, if possible, is to unsubscribe from AllMail on all devices to avoid that confusion. Deleting from AllMail on the phone causes the message to be also deleted from whatever folder the message is in.

content:
Messaggio non trovato significa di solito che c'è un disallineamento tra l'indice dei messaggi e l'archivio dei messaggi. In pratica il messaggio è ancora presente nell'indice ma è stato cancellato dall'archivio.

Il disallineamento si può correggere, ma i messaggi mancati di solito non ricompaiono. Per ripristinare quei messaggi o si scaricano nuovamente dal server (se ci sono ancora) o c'è bisogno di un backup.

content:
I solved it, the star was the default email so gmail somehow got set as default. I highlighted my primary sbcglobal.net email and then selected set as default and the star moved there.

Thanks
creator: peterwolfs

content:
When you create a new message, the From account is the same as the account for the currently opened folder, no matter which account is the default. So, if the SBC Inbox is selected, a new message will show that account in the From box.

See also https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/identity-chooser/

Make sure your sbc account is sending on the sbc smtp, not the gmail smtp. Select an account in the left pane of Account Settings, note the Outgoing Server (SMTP) in the right pane.
creator: sfhowes

content:
The outgoing server for live, hotmail, outlook.com, msn etc. accounts is the same:

smtp.office365.com, 587, STARTTLS, OAuth2 authentication, User Name = email address.

The incoming is outlook.office365.com, 993 (IMAP) or 995 (POP), SSL/TLS, OAuth2 authentication, User Name = email address.
